intro: Dichapetalum vondrozanum, commonly known as the Vondroza sand mat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic, with a hairy surface, and it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. It is often found in open, disturbed habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
